item.title: Advent of Code 2021
item.description: Is it Advent of Code time again? Well, here goes nothing.

item.title: Lighting Control Rack Overhaul
item.description: I tasked myself with overhauling one of the lighting control closets at work.

item.title: KVM Stand
item.description: My work often involves switching between several computers - a laptop, a beefier desktop, an ‘IT Sanctioned’ clean machine with access to the work network, and a temporary line to whatever computer’s on the workbench.

item.title: Virgin Receiver
item.description: One of the earliest homebrew ham radio transceivers I built was a direct-conversion receiver for the 40m band.

item.title: DIN Rail DAC Mount
item.description: One of our retrofit projects at work required using four small DAC boards to converet 0-5V PWM into true 0-10V analog voltage.

item.title: Airflow Passthrough
item.description: The airflow situation is often very stuffy, especially in the summer months.

item.title: Analog Meter Class
item.description: On October 24th 2021, I taught an online streamed class on using Analog meters in electronics projects.

item.title: Estate Sale (Oct '21)
item.description: In October 2021, I attended the estate sale of a recently-passed Ham Radio operator (“silent key”).

item.title: Resistor Organization
item.description: In April 2016, I undertook to properly organize my E12 series resistors in a way that I could actually find the darn resistor I was looking for when I needed it.

item.title: Votive Fence Hooks
item.description: I had very little to do with this one, but just think it’s neat - a friend was hosting a small backyard wedding, and while he had designed a 3D-printed hook to hold votive candles on a fence, his printer was down.

item.title: Demilight
item.description: The Demilight project began in 2019 with the goal of creating a 3D printable, miniature moving light controlled by an Arduino-compatible microcontroller.

item.title: LoRa-DMX Wireless LED Controller
item.description: In the late summer of 2021, I was contracted to implement a remotely-triggered Pixel LED controller for a client.

item.title: Cloudfront for HTTPs
item.description: To a layman's eye, using AWS Cloudfront to enable HTTPs on a website seems like using a bazooka to blast a butterfly - massively overkill with far more power than necessary.

item.title: Getting Started with AWS
item.description: I'm always looking for ways to expand my skillset, and in an increasingly digital, work-from-home oriented world, having a firmer grasp on web technologies seems like not a bad thing.

item.title: First Parks on the Air Activation - K-4160, Volo Bog
item.description: I mentioned in my Field Day post from a few weeks ago that I was hoping to get out to a Parks on the Air activation soon, and this past Saturday, I made it happen!

item.title: Ham Radio Field Day 2021 - Storms and Stations
item.description: This post is cross-posted to my Ham Radio specific blog, kk9jef.

item.title: Advent of Code 2020: Day 2-9
item.description: .js"-- Code for all days is on GitHub Day 2 Nothing terribly fancy going on with the day 2 challenge - essentially, reading in a text file and doing operations on strings.

item.title: Advent of Code 2020: Day 1
item.description: I know in my introductory post I said I wasn't going to post something every day, and I meant it!

item.title: Advent of Code 2020
item.description: Last winter, I participated in the annual Advent of Code Challenge, a website which offers small (but not necessarily easy) programming challenges every day from December 1 through 25.

item.title: Demilight-version 0.9.1
item.description: The Demilight (miniature moving light) project has been slowed down in the past few months, mostly by good things.

item.title: How to Livestream a (Technology Focused) Class
item.description: In BC times (Before Covid), I had often dreamed of setting up a semi-regular gathering with some nerd friends to make things.

item.title: Demilight Version 0.8.1
item.description: The newest round of Demilight PCBs and 3D-Prints have taken shape as version 0.

item.title: Reverse Engineering and Replacing an Industrial 7-Segment Display – Part 2, Investigation
item.description: This is Part 2 of an N-part series. See also [Part 1].

item.title: PICO-8: Orbit
item.description: Over the past couple weeks, as a way to stretch my programming legs and play around with a new system, I've been writing a little demo in the 8-bit retro video game environment called PICO-8.

item.title: Video: Demilight Version 0.8
item.description: It's been quite awhile since the mini-moving light project (now renamed The Demilight) has been written up on the blog.

item.title: Stream - Electrics and Electronics Bash - Arduino #1
item.description: This Sunday evening, March 22nd 2020 at 7pm Central time, I'll be hosting a livestreaming Introduction to Arduino over on YouTube!

item.title: Geared Nameplate
item.description: A quickie today - over the weekend, I decided that my workshop at work needed a nameplate outside the door, to make it a little easier for folks to find me.

item.title: Reverse Engineering and Replacing an Industrial 7-Segment Display - Part 1, Research
item.description: Building one-off hardware is one part inventing, one part dissecting, one part scrounging.

item.title: Setting up an Electronics Lab - Tools
item.description: Between 10 years working in stage lighting, live video, and theatrical special effects; three moves and two home workbench-overhauls; and my new-this-month position as an Exhibit Engineer at a major Midwest science museum, I've planned and kitted-out many electronics workbenches over the years.

item.title: Closet Door Locker
item.description: Yesterday I install a new closet door in our front entrance hall, and discovered a problem which I then solved with 3D Printing.

item.title: ETC Console Output Counts
item.description: What follows is a list of output-counts for ETC Eos Family consoles.

item.title: Arduino DMX 'Light Board', Mini Moving Light Hanging Hardware
item.description: Over the past week, I got to the point with the mini moving light that I needed some way to consistently pump DMX into my prototypes to test their functionality.

item.title: DMX Mini Moving Light First Assembly - Live Stream
item.description: With the shell 3D-printed and the PCB assembled, I went ahead and put together my first "

item.title: DMX Mini Moving Light Shield V0.3
item.description: As I hinted to in my original post about the Arduino Pro Mini DMX Shield, and then talked some about in my PCB Assembly Livestream, the latest version of my DMX shield is geared toward driving in miniature moving light.

item.title: DMX Mini Mover Shield PCB Assembly Stream
item.description: Last night, as I started to assemble V0.3 of my DMX Mini-Mover Shield, I thought it might be fun to switch on my webcam and stream the assembly live to the World Wide Web.

item.title: 3D Printing in the Home Workshop
item.description: With the bulk of the shelving and organization overhaul complete as of last week, I've spent the last week starting to personalize my home workshop space, mostly using my 3D Printer.

item.title: Home Office Overhaul
item.description: You may get the impression from this blog that I like to dabble in a lot of different projects.

item.title: Lighting Control Protocols and Standards
item.description: The world of stage lighting uses a variety of communication protocols to link control devices (computers, light boards, houselighting systems) to endpoint devices (lights, dimmers, effects).

item.title: CDV-720 3A High Range Radiation Meter
item.description: This post is cross-posted to my ham-radio specific blog, kk9jef.wordpress.com

item.title: Homemade Cheddar Cheese
item.description: Over the past 12 months or so, I've dipped my toes into some basic cheesemaking, including cream cheese, farmer's cheese, and ricotta.

item.title: 150 Switches
item.description: I got lots of wonderful little gifties for my recent birthday, but one of the most out-there was a bag of 150 Assorted Rocker Slide and Toggle switches from Jameco.

item.title: 50W QRP Amplifier - 3D Printed Case Design and Livestream
item.description: With the 50W QRP amplifier project coming along nicely, I felt it was time to start thinking about a reproducible case for the project.

item.title: 50W QRP Amplifier - Schematic, PCB Ver 1
item.description: The 5W-to-50W QRP HF Amplifier project is rolling along nicely - I received the first PCB draft in the male this week and am 90% of the way through assembling it, with only heatsink-placement left to sort out.

item.title: 50W QRP Amplifier – PCB Layout Video
item.description: This past weekend, I started on the process of laying out the 50W QRP Amplifier project as a PCB.

item.description: This post is cross-posted to my ham-radio specific blog, kk9jef.wordpress.com.

item.title: Geared 7-Segment Display, Part 4 - Pinion Gears and First Rotation
item.description: This weekend I've added the pinion gears to the seven-segment display, and performed the first test rotation of the mechanism.

item.title: Dayton Hamvention 2018
item.description: This post is cross-posted to my ham radio-specific blog, kk9jef.wordpress.com.

item.title: Geared 7-Segment Display, Part 3 - Drive Gear Interlocks
item.description: The heart of the seven segment display is the seven drive gears with select teeth, which share a common shaft and all rotate together.

item.title: Geared 7-Segment Display - Part 2, More Gears
item.description: While time at home is scarce this week, I've stolen a couple moments late night to continue working on the design of the geared 7-segment display, including finishing the modelling of the 7 drive gears.

item.title: Geared 7-Segment Display - Part 1
item.description: Over the weekend, I got started on a project I’ve been musing about for a few months – making a mechanical 7-segment display, using gears to move individual segments in and out of the display area via rotation of a central shaft or belt.

item.title: Faceted Lampshade from Clear PLA
item.description: I've had a clear, "low poly" angular sculpture in clear PLA sitting on my self for awhile now.

item.title: Hello, World! Again!
item.description: I must have started half a dozen blogs in my life.
